lines.text:
[on seeing the Greek naval fleet approaching]
The face that launched a thousand ships!

[seeing the Trojan horse]
Beware Greeks bearing gifts.
Make me immortal with a kiss!
Forgive me Helen. You're two women. Both wise and good. I am two men, one fairly good, I try to believe and the other very bad indeed.
One is a man, the other just a boy I think... Paris, let him be so always... Never let him grow old.
Oh Goddess come to Earth. Make me a mortal with your kiss and we'll live on nectar and ambrosia...
... But I am not sure I like being so ethereal.
There's away Gods have... To give with one hand and take with two.
